content: Finally, we continue to invest in our rental fleet with a gross investment of $128.3 million in the quarter, resulting in record gross expenditures for the year of $507.8 million. Strong core fundamentals in the quarter, combined with our fleet growth, successful branch expansion program and the addition of One Source operations resulted in a 34.6% year-over-year increase in rental revenue to $245 million. Rental rates in the quarter, which exclude One Source, remained impressive, improving 10.6% when compared to the fourth quarter of â21 and 1.8% on a sequential quarterly basis. As in the case of the sale of two Arkansas distribution branches in the third quarter of 2021, fourth quarter 2022 results were not adjusted for the $15.4 million gain on the sale as the transaction remains consistent with the company's exit from all material business arrangements involving distribution. Fourth quarter revenues totaled $353.1 million improving $71.8 million or 25.6%, when compared to the fourth quarter of 2021. We concluded the fourth quarter with a fleet five as measured by original equipment cost or OEC of approximately $2.4 billion, representing a net increase in OEC of $498 million, when compared to the fourth quarter of 2021. Rental rates in the fourth quarter, excluding One Source, were 10.6% better than the year ago quarter and 1.8% ahead of the third quarter of 2022. Average physical fleet utilization in the fourth quarter was 72% was 110 basis below the year ago measure with ordinary seasonal patterns in the quarter, modestly impeding results. Across other business segments, used equipment sales in the fourth quarter saw its best result in 2022, improving to $30.2 million, compared to $29.5 million in the fourth quarter of 2021. Consolidated gross profit in the fourth quarter improved $41.2 million or 34.8% to $159.4 million, compared to $118.2 million in the year ago quarter. Total equipment rental margins were 47.9% in the fourth quarter of 2022, compared to 46.3% in the year-ago quarter. Income from operations increased $37.2 million in the fourth quarter of 2022 or 89.4% to $78.8 million, compared to $41.6 million in the fourth quarter of 2021. Net income in the fourth quarter totaled $51.2 million or $1.41 per diluted share, compared to $21.7 million or $0.59 per diluted share in the year ago quarter. Our transaction with WPI contributed 440 basis points to our fourth quarter margin, due to the pretax $15.4 million gains recorded on the sale of PP&E and other net. Regarding SG&A, expenses in the fourth quarter totaled $94.5 million, an increase of $17.1 million or 22%, compared to the fourth quarter of 2021. Approximately $3.3 million of the increased expense in the quarter was attributable to the addition of One Source with another $3.6 million related to our branch expansion efforts, which added 10 new branches over the year. Capital expenditures in the fourth quarter totaled $128.3 million, including non-cash transfers from inventory, resulting in a total gross capital investment for the year of $507.8 million. Net rental fleet capital expenditures in the fourth quarter were  (ph) million, with net rental fleet expenditures for the year totaling $424.1 million. Net cash provided by operating activities totaled $102 million in the fourth quarter and $313.2 million for the year and free cash flow used in the fourth quarter and full-year of 2022 was $128 million and $233.3 million, respectively, demonstrating the company's focus on fleet growth and expansion through new branch locations and acquisitions. As I noted earlier, our rental fleet size based on original equipment cost closed 2022 at approximately $2.4 billion an increase of $498.5 million or 26.8% larger than our fleet size at the close of 2021 and a record level for H&E.
